bug.author: sjiang2018
bug.summary: [Bug] run time error when converting variational models to TorchScript
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
traced_model saving issue <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
** Code snippet to reproduce ** # Your code goes here class MeanVarModelWrapper(nn.Module): def __init__(self, gp): super().__init__() self.gp = gp
def forward(self, x): output_dist = self.gp(x) return output_dist.mean, output_dist.variance
def save_gp(model, test_x): wrapped_model = MeanVarModelWrapper(model) with torch.no_grad(): fake_input = test_x pred = wrapped_model(fake_input) # Compute caches traced_model = torch.jit.trace(wrapped_model, fake_input, check_trace=False) logging.info("saving model") traced_model.save('/tmp/traced_gp_example.pt')
# Please make sure it does not require any external dependencies (other than PyTorch!) # (We much prefer small snippets rather than links to existing libraries!) ** Stack trace/error message ** <denchmark-code> File "./gp_regression/gpytorch_train_example.py", line 127, in <module> save_gp(gp_model, test_x) File "./gp_regression/gpytorch_train_example.py", line 107, in save_gp traced_model.save('/tmp/traced_gp_example.pt') File "/home/sjiang/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 1626, in save return self._c.save(*args, **kwargs) RuntimeError: Could not export Python function call 'MaternCovariance'. Remove calls to Python functions before export. Did you forget add @script or @script_method annotation? If this is a nn.ModuleList, add it to __constants__:
// Paste the bad output here! </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>System information</denchmark-h>
Please complete the following information:
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
I am following the instruction listed here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/blob/ff1881b5fe92147f5e34e4141c0d5255e2650fdc/examples/08_Advanced_Usage/TorchScript_Variational_Models.ipynb>https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/blob/ff1881b5fe92147f5e34e4141c0d5255e2650fdc/examples/08_Advanced_Usage/TorchScript_Variational_Models.ipynb</denchmark-link>
except: self.covar_module = MaternKernel()

comments.comment: Oops -- add gpytorch.settings.trace_mode() to your context list in addition to torch.no_grad(). So: with gpytorch.settings.trace_mode(), torch.no_grad(): I'll update this in the example notebook.
I tried that also, but there is error saying "gpytorch.settings has no attribute "trace_mode" ".

model tracing isn't on an officialy release yet. You need to run on master for now. Here's the setting:
gpytorch/gpytorch/settings.py
Line 512 in 5cfd9cf
class trace_mode(_feature_flag):
Thank you for your reply. It works now.
